frontmatter.title: Tachyon - 2016-01 ServiceRocket Engineering Hackaton

frontmatter.description: I'd like to share my work on writing JavaScript DOM unit testing on a existing codebase in one of our Confluence plugins.
frontmatter.title: JavaScript DOM Testing With Mocha + Grunt + Chai jQuery

frontmatter.description: I've been working on developing this webapp project. Basically, we break the logical parts of the code into entity layer, service layer and UI layer. The data structure is not that complex, so we thought that we use Hibernate ORM to do its magic. All the plumbing works between these layers were managed via Spring dependency injection.
frontmatter.title: Powermock with JUnit 4 to Test Spring+Hibernate Architecture

frontmatter.description: I just recalled an interesting theory mentioned by my C lecturer back in uni days, use ++i instead of i++ in a for-loop.
frontmatter.title: For-loop, to ++i or i++ or not?
